hotspots.label: Long Antennae
hotspots.fact: Grasshoppers use their long antennae to feel vibrations and sense their surroundings. These antennae help them detect danger and find food in grass and plants.

hotspots.label: Powerful Back Legs
hotspots.fact: Grasshoppers have huge back legs filled with strong muscles that help them jump up to 20 times their own body length! This helps them escape from predators quickly.

hotspots.label: Large Eyes
hotspots.fact: Grasshoppers have big eyes that can see in many directions at once. This helps them spot predators approaching from different angles while they eat.

hotspots.label: Green Camouflage
hotspots.fact: Grasshoppers are green to blend in with grass and leaves in their habitat. This camouflage helps protect them from animals that hunt them for food.
